title: How does the CRED app work? How useful is it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sincerely I feel that there is no other app or platform that rewards you when you make credit card payments. Obviously your credit card company rewards you with points when you make a purchase, but what happens when you pay that huge ransom of money to credit card company? CRED helps you in earning some points and you can use them from a wide variety of options. Some people might come here and share their experience of when they lost money, meaning that money was deducted from their account successfully and CRED is completely denying it. This can happen to anyone and using any online platform whatsoever. There is a great system behind how the transactions work and you should immediately get in touch with your bank to confirm if the payment you made was successful at beneficiary’s end as well. Also I am the one who lost ₹15,000 by making multiple payments and CRED never claimed that they got the money. One fine day I put my foot down, sent like 10 emails to all the people I could find associated with CRED, got in touch with my bank and confirmed every transaction made to CRED and if it was successfully sent to the beneficiary. My emails weren’t answered, I took it to TWITTER and guess what, my ₹15,000 was settled in less than 30minutes. TWITTER is the place where CRED is most responsive. Take your issues there and the team will resolve it. Also note that TWITTER is the last resort, after this, there is no place other than their office in Bengaluru to go to. Sharing my experience, thats all!

CRED is a members-only app that offers you exclusive rewards for paying your credit card bill.Led by Kunal Shah, the founder of FreeCharge, CRED aims to make paying credit card bills simpler and reward you for paying them on time. The app asks for your phone number to check your credit score with Cibil, CRIF and Experian. If your credit score is 750 or higher, you are granted access to CRED app else you join a wait list. The app scans any credit cards linked to your phone number and adds them to the app. As you pay your credit card bills you are credited with Cred coins that can be burned in exchange of exclusive partner deals across various lifestyle categories. ​The benefits of using CRED1. Get rewarded for paying credit card bills through CRED app and enjoy being part of an exclusive community that gives access to unique products/ experiences.2. There are additional reward points for debit card payments.3. CRED also offers transaction tracking and guides you on any additional rewards that are applicable to be redeemed on your credit card. How to get started with CRED?CRED can be accessed only if you have a credit score (CIBIL) of 750 and above. CRED requests access and verifies your current credit score from credit bureaus like Experian, Crif and CIBIL. If you qualify, the app will integrate existing cards to your CRED account. A detailed registration guide is mentioned below: • Install the app from your Android/IoS mobile phone and sign up with your mobile number.• After verifying your number by OTP, the app will check your credit score and notify you if you are eligible for the service.• On successful verification, the app will add all credit cards linked to your mobile number. You can add up to 10 credit cards at a time, with the option to add more if required.• You must verify your card details by adding in the masked numbers.• CRED will instantly verify your card/cards by depositing Re.1 through IMPS/UPI.• After verification, you can pay your credit card bills and earn reward points equal to the bill amount paid. Making Credit Card Payments on CREDYou can pay your credit card bills through net banking, debit card, or UPI. The steps are listed as below - • Log in to your CRED account through the app. Under the ‘Cards’ tab, choose the card/cards whose bill you wish to pay.• The bill amount as well as minimum due etc. will be displayed on-screen. Click on ‘Pay Now’ and enter the amount you wish to pay.• Choose the method of bill payment:• If you’re paying through UPI, you will have to link your UPI address and verify the same before making your payment.• If you’re paying through debit card, add the card details. After CRED has verified your card, you can authorize the payment.• If you’re paying through net banking, select your bank from the list. You will be redirected to your bank’s net banking page to complete the transaction.• After a successful transaction, you will receive a transaction ID for your reference. The app will also reflect the amount paid.• Depending on the bank/method of payment, it could take up to 2 working days for the payment to be realized by your bank. How CRED benefits you?• Apart from being a one-stop platform for paying credit card bills, you also earn reward points for every Rupee paid towards the bill payment. The reward points referred to as ‘CRED coins’, are redeemable on various offerings on the CRED app. • Offers are updated regularly on the app, and you can redeem aka burn your CRED coins across different category products.• You can track your payment history for all cards added on the platform, as well as keep track of upcoming bills.• Features such as ‘Kill the bill’ enable you to earn cashback towards repaying your bill.• You will get a reminder each time your card bill is generated, ensuring you don’t miss/delay a payment. Things to Know• You can pay your entire bill amount for all credit cards added on the platform. But payments made through debit cards are capped at Rs.2,000 for security reasons.• CRED does not charge for verifying your cards or credit card payments made through the app.
